6// This mutating tree traversal works around a bug in the HLSL compiler optimizer with "pow" that
7// manifests under the following conditions:
8//
9// - If pow() has a literal exponent value
10// - ... and this value is integer or within 10e-6 of an integer
11// - ... and it is in {-4, -3, -2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8}
12//
13// The workaround is to replace the pow with a series of multiplies.
14// See http://anglebug.com/851
15
16#ifndef COMPILER_TRANSLATOR_TREEOPS_EXPANDINTEGERPOWEXPRESSIONS_H_
17#define COMPILER_TRANSLATOR_TREEOPS_EXPANDINTEGERPOWEXPRESSIONS_H_
18
19#include "common/angleutils.h"
20
21namespace sh
22{
23
24class TCompiler;
25class TIntermNode;
26class TSymbolTable;
27
28ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool ExpandIntegerPowExpressions(TCompiler *compiler,
29 TIntermNode *root,
30 TSymbolTable *symbolTable);
31
32} // namespace sh
33
34#endif // COMPILER_TRANSLATOR_TREEOPS_EXPANDINTEGERPOWEXPRESSIONS_H_
35
